# loadAction

**Instance Property**

The action performed by this attachment at the start of a rendering pass for a render command encoder.

## Declaration

```swift
var loadAction: MTLLoadAction { get set }
```

## Discussion

If your app renders all pixels of the render target for a given frame, use the [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLLoadAction/dontCare] action, which allows the GPU to avoid loading the existing contents of the texture. Otherwise, use the [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLLoadAction/clear] action to clear the previous contents of the render target or the [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLLoadAction/load] action to preserve them. The [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLLoadAction/clear] action also avoids the cost of loading the existing texture contents, but it still incurs the cost of filling the destination with a clear color.

For color render targets, the default value is [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLLoadAction/dontCare]. For depth or stencil render targets, the default value is [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLLoadAction/clear].

## Specifying rendering pass actions

- **storeAction**: The action performed by this attachment at the end of a rendering pass for a render command encoder.
- **storeActionOptions**: The options that modify the store action performed by this attachment.
